nodes.bodyText: This is the actual code that caused the issue with #4427, this selection tool is always assuming that you're going to be claiming land. Also below in the circle-shape selector.
Could use MathUtil.distanceSquared(x, z) <= MathUtil.sqr(r) as an alternative.
Can replace loop with a closed-sum formula. neededBlocks += 4 * r * (r + 1)
Removed because we're doing the same thing anyways when someone does /t unclaim
pos.add() returns a new worldcoord, so this entire line can be replaced with out.add(pos.add(x,z));
t seems to be used purely to swap variables, so it should only be in that scope.
Create a variable swap here to clarify intentions.
Might be worth it to divide by two in the initialization that consistently dividing by two in the for-loop.
